articles.author: Bill Hutchinson
articles.title: Florida 'stand your ground' shooter charged with manslaughter
articles.description: The Florida man who invoked the "stand your ground" self-defense law after shooting a black man in a dispute over a parking space was charged Monday with manslaughter.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Iran's top leader bans any negotiations with Washington
articles.description: Get breaking national and world news, broadcast video coverage, and exclusive interviews. Find the top news online at ABC news.

articles.author: Aaron Katersky
articles.title: Inside the global manhunt for father accused of dumping his infant in New York river
articles.description: The crime was extreme, even by New York City’s already extreme standards: a 7-month-old found by a tourist floating lifelessly in the murky water of the East River.

articles.author: Emily Shapiro
articles.title: New website allows community to submit anonymous tips in Iowa jogger case
articles.description: Mollie Tibbetts, 20, vanished while on a jog in Brooklyn, Iowa, on July 18.

articles.author: Joyeeta Biswas
articles.title: Pilot dies after plane crashes into home with couple inside
articles.description: One person died after a plane crashed into a Utah home Monday, authorities said.

articles.author: Elizabeth McLaughlin and Lena Masri
articles.title: US general pushing Saudis to investigate deadly Yemen strike: Pentagon
articles.description: Local officials say dozens of children were killed when their bus was hit.

articles.author: Max Golembo
articles.title: Flash flooding threat continues for East Coast after wet weekend
articles.description: The Northeast received flooding rains over the weekend.

articles.author: Karma Allen
articles.title: Girl, 7, dies after being struck by stray bullet while sitting in car
articles.description: Authorities are offering as much as $11,000 for information leading to an arrest.

articles.author: Joyeeta Biswas
articles.title: Parents to sue after boy with autism pinned down and handcuffed by officer
articles.description: The parents of a boy with autism in Denton, Texas, say they are planning to take legal action after they received a video showing their son being pinned down and cuffed.

articles.author: Emily Shapiro
articles.title: Baby boy dies after he's left for hours in scorching hot car
articles.description: A 6-month-old boy died after being left for hours in a hot car in a parking lot outside a Domino's restaurant in Virginia, police said.

articles.author: Kate Taylor
articles.title: Rapper Azealia Banks claims she was at Elon Musk's house over the weekend as he was 'scrounging for investors'
articles.description: Rapper Azealia Banks claimed she watched Musk "scrounging for investors" after tweeting his plans to take Tesla private last week, and that he did not "have any funding secured."

articles.author: Rob Price
articles.title: Meet 16 of Facebook’s most important engineers, working on its biggest products and guiding its future
articles.description: BI PRIME: From Messenger to blockchain, from Oculus to security, these are the engineers building Facebook and its most important products.

articles.author: Akin Oyedele
articles.title: A bunch of millennials who use hot startups to manage their investments are getting whacked by Turkey's currency crisis
articles.description: The plunge in the Turkish lira to new lows also hurt the Vanguard FTSE Emerging Markets ETF, which has slumped nearly 4% in the past week. The ETF's top-10 owners include Betterment and Wealthfront, two robo-advisors that predominantly cater to millennials.

articles.author: Oscar Williams-Grut
articles.title: Inside Symphony's battle to break into a $28 billion market for Wall Street chat — and avoid becoming Bloomberg roadkill
articles.description: BI PRIME: Banks, asset managers, and even Google have invested almost $300 million into Symphony, a secure, cloud-based chat platform conceived as a hub for any and all financial work. The goal for: to help build a viable competitor to Bloomberg LP.

articles.author: Catalina Gonella, Noah Friedman
articles.title: How to hack an election, according to a former NSA hacker
articles.description: Former NSA hacker David Kennedy reveals what it takes to hack an election.

articles.author: Linette Lopez
articles.title: It is now abundantly clear that Elon Musk does not have 'funding secured'
articles.description: Elon Musk's explanation for why he announced that he's "considering" taking Tesla private doesn't hold water for anyone wondering how he's going to pay for it, or how he's going to structure the deal.

articles.author: Mike Shields
articles.title: 'That model is behind the times': Activist investor Elliott thinks Nielsen dropped the ball on data and tech — and needs to sell fast
articles.description: Elliott Management Corporation now owns 8.5% of the research firm Nielsen. The activist investor believes that Nielsen has been slow to invest in software and technology, and has been too reliant on a people-heavy business model. It wants Nielsen to sell.

articles.author: Lydia Ramsey
articles.title: A VC who invested in Oscar and Flatiron Health explains why he sees disagreement about an investment as a sign it's a killer deal
articles.description: BI PRIME: Venture investor Krishna Yeshwant uses a healthy amount of skepticism when vetting potential companies to invest in.  His favorite time to invest is when one of his partners at the fund is excited about a particular company, even if nobody else is.

articles.author: Oscar Williams-Grut
articles.title: Inside Symphony's battle to break into a $28 billion market for Wall Street chat — and avoid becoming Bloomberg roadkill
articles.description: BI PRIME: Banks, asset managers, and even Google have invested almost $300 million into Symphony, a secure, cloud-based chat platform conceived as a hub for any and all financial work. The goal for: to help build a viable competitor to Bloomberg LP.

articles.author: Rob Price
articles.title: Meet 16 of Facebook’s most important engineers, working on its biggest products and guiding its future
articles.description: BI PRIME: From Messenger to blockchain, from Oculus to security, these are the engineers building Facebook and its most important products.
